name: Yu Tian 0001
content: Yu Tian Yu Tian is an Assistant Professor of Computer Science at University of Central Florida (UCF), with a joint appointment in the Department of Clinical Sciences at the College of Medicine. He is also affiliated with the UCF Institute of Artificial Intelligence and directs the AI & Imaging in Medicine (AIM) Research Lab. Before joining UCF, Dr. Tian was a postdoctoral researcher at Harvard University and the University of Pennsylvania. He completed both his Ph.D. (in just three years) and his B.Sc. with First Class Honours in Computer Science at the Australian Institute for Machine Learning (AIML), Adelaide University. ðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥ I am actively seeking highly motivated Ph.D. students, Masterâ€™s students, and interns/visiting students to join my research group. If you are interested in working on cutting-edge AI research in computer vision and medical imaging, please visit our Join Us page for detailed information about available positions and research opportunities. News Oct, 2025 One paper on weakly supervised pathology classification is accepted to Journal of Medical Imaging (JMI). Check out the paper and codes here. Oct, 2025 One paper on benchmarking group fairness in federated medical imaging is accepted to IEEE Transactions on Medical Imaging (TMI). Check out the paper here, dataset and code here. Sep, 2025 One paper on fairness-aware medical image generation is accepted to MICCAI. Check out the paper here. Jul, 2025 One paper on fairness is accepted to Translational Vision Science & Technology and selected as the cover article. Check out the paper here. Mar, 2025 One paper on fairness in diffusion models is accepted to Science Advances. Check out the paper and codes here.
